title: Pythonw using python 2.7 instead of python 3.
body:
Hi, I have some issues trying to install deeplabcut on my macbook. I am new to using Anaconda environments and never used deeplabcut before or python. **Operating system** **DeepLabCut version** OS: macOS Catalina version 10.15.7 DeepLabCut Version: not installed yet Anaconda env used: anaconda 3. **Description of the problem** I have installed DLC-CPU.yaml in the Anaconda 3 environment following the tutorial detailed here https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/installation.md. I entered the environment and run pythonw to import deeplabcut. I got a message error: ImportError: No module named deeplabcut (see below) **Terminal output with pythonw:** >(base) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ conda activate DLC-CPU >(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ pythonw >WARNING: Python 2.7 is not recommended. >This version is included in macOS for compatibility with legacy software. >Future versions of macOS will not include Python 2.7. >Instead, it is recommended that you transition to using 'python3' from within >Terminal. >Python 2.7.16 (default, Jun 5 2020, 22:59:21) >[GCC 4.2.1 Compatible Apple LLVM 11.0.3 (clang-1103.0.29.20) >(-macos10.15-objc- on darwin >Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import deeplabcut Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in ImportError: No module named deeplabcut >>> I tried the following command to identify the path for pythonw: >(base) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ which pythonw >/Users/sbaudouin/opt/anaconda3/bin/pythonw >(base) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ I assume that the path should be correct at it uses the anaconda 3 environment but somehow the system is using python 2.7 and not python 3. I wanted to check which version of python would be triggered if I type python instead of pythonw in the DLC-CPU environment. I was also curious to see if the import/launch of deeplabcut would work and it does not (unsurprisingly). Here is what I got: **Terminal output with python:** >(base) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ conda activate DLC-CPU >(DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ python >Python 3.7.10 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Feb 19 2021, 15:59:12) >[Clang 11.0.1 ] on darwin >Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import deeplabcut >>> deeplabcut.launch_dlc() This program needs access to the screen. Please run with a Framework build of python, and only when you are logged in on the main display of your Mac. (DLC-CPU) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ I also tried the which python command and here is what I have: >(base) stal-lt04:~ sbaudouin$ which python >/Users/sbaudouin/opt/anaconda3/bin/python

I have tried uninstall/reinstall but the problem persists. I believe that my issue is related to launching the wrong version of python when using pythonw command. As I understand, python 3 should be built in the anaconda 3 environment. I do not know how to address this problem further, so if you have some suggestions I would be very happy to read them. Thanks in advance St√©phane
